name: bookable

bookable adjective
(ARRANGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A bookable seat, room, performer, etc. can be booked for a particular time in the future.

bookable adjective
(RECORD)
A bookable offence (= something you do wrong) is one that a police officer, referee, etc. can book you for, by writing down your name in an official record.
